title: Ticket #1440: ClassAd interval() function doesn't work as advertised
description:
The ClassAd function interval() is used to take a number of seconds (as an integer) and returns a string representing the corresponding interval of time expressed in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, like so: days+hours:minutes:seconds. Any leading values of 0 are dropped, along with their punctuation. So interval(67) should evaluate to "1:07". The descriptions of this function in old and new ClassAds agree on this.

However, the function never drops leading 0s and the days field is padded out to a minimum of 3 characters with leading spaces. So interval(67) actually evaluates to "<space><space>0+00:01:07".

The code should probably be changed to match the documentation.
remarks:
2010-Jun-09 17:40:03 by jfrey:
The docs are unclear as to when single-digit values in the string should be zero-padded. One of the examples is "17+1:02:03", which has zero-padding for minutes and seconds, but not hours. I think this should be changed so that hours are also zero-padded when they aren't the leading number.

2010-Jun-11 09:59:44 by jfrey:
Pushed fix to master for ClassAds 1.0.9.
